Token.Abstract: This class is a subclass of UITableViewController and is used to display all the configurations available in the app.
Function that gets called when the view controller has loaded the view
Function that gets called when there's a memory leak or warning
Asks the data source to return the number of sections in the table view.

Parameter.Name: tableView
Parameter.Abstract: An object representing the table view requesting this information.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The number of sections in tableView. The default value is 1.

Token.Abstract: Tells the data source to return the number of rows in a given section of a table view. (required)

Parameter.Name: tableView
Parameter.Abstract: The table-view object requesting this information.

Parameter.Name: section
Parameter.Abstract: An index number identifying a section in tableView.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The number of rows in section.

Token.Abstract: Asks the data source for the title of the footer of the specified section of the table view.

Parameter.Name: tableView
Parameter.Abstract: The table-view object asking for the title.

Parameter.Name: section
Parameter.Abstract: An index number identifying a section of tableView .

ReturnValue.Abstract: A string to use as the title of the section footer. If you return nil , the section will have no title.

Token.Abstract: Asks the delegate for the height to use for the footer of a particular section.

Parameter.Name: tableView
Parameter.Abstract: The table-view object requesting this information.

Parameter.Name: section
Parameter.Abstract: An index number identifying a section of tableView .

ReturnValue.Abstract: A nonnegative floating-point value that specifies the height (in points) of the footer for section.

Token.Abstract: Function that calculates the height of a view that will contain a given text with an specific font and text size.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The height needed to display the text

Token.Abstract: Asks the delegate for a view object to display in the footer of the specified section of the table view.

Parameter.Name: tableView
Parameter.Abstract: The table-view object asking for the view object.

Parameter.Name: section
Parameter.Abstract: An index number identifying a section of tableView .

ReturnValue.Abstract: A view object to be displayed in the footer of section .

Token.Abstract: Asks the delegate for the height to use for a row in a specified location.

Parameter.Name: tableView
Parameter.Abstract: The table-view object requesting this information.

Parameter.Name: indexPath
Parameter.Abstract: An index path that locates a row in tableView.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A nonnegative floating-point value that specifies the height (in points) that row should be.

Token.Abstract: Asks the data source for a cell to insert in a particular location of the table view. (required)

Parameter.Name: tableView
Parameter.Abstract: A table-view object requesting the cell.

Parameter.Name: indexPath
Parameter.Abstract: An index path locating a row in tableView.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An object inheriting from UITableViewCell that the table view can use for the specified row. An assertion is raised if you return nil.

Token.Abstract: Function that loads if the user has selected a custom date

ReturnValue.Abstract: A bool with the answer to the query

Token.Abstract: Function that gets called when the user selects the stared cell
Function that gets called when the user selects the custom locations cell
